conclusion: To determine the position of point O1 relative to point O, analyze the refraction of light from air to water.
Understanding refraction: Light bends towards the normal when moving from air to water.
Point A is in the air, Point B is in the water, Point O is the intersection of line AB with the boundary.
Point O1 is where the light ray enters the water.
The light ray from point A travels towards the boundary and bends towards the normal as it enters the water.
The incident ray (from A to O1) and the refracted ray (from O1 to B) form angles with the normal.
Since the light bends towards the normal, point O1 must be closer to the normal than point O.
O1 is to the right of O if the normal is considered vertical and the light bends towards it.
The statement that O1 is to the right of O is correct.
Final Answer: Yes, O1 is to the right of O.
